Health Status
Summary of Hospitalization :
Pt is a **AGE[in 70s] yo woman who was at an outpatient appointment with vascular surgery for surgical follow-up ( fistula placed on **DATE[Feb 28 07] ) when she began to complain of transient chest discomfort .
She was refferred to the presby ED where her SBP was found to be above 200 .
She was then admitted for BP control and r/o MI .
Past Medical History :
DM
HTN
ESRD on HD MWFri
New fistula placed in L arm ( **DATE[Feb 28 07] )
TDC in place h/o CVA/TIA
OA
CAD s/p MI
CHF

Dr. **NAME[ZZZ]
Pt is Jehovah wittness , refuses blood transfusions
Subjective / Events Overnight :
Pt states that she feels back to her baseline

General Appearance :
Elderly AAF resting in bed NAD .
Cardiovascular :
S1 S2 no MRG RRR .

Incont urine .
Wears adult diaper .

No edema or calf tenderness bilat LE .

Follows commans , very pleasant .
Right chest TDC in place  .

IMPRESSION :
MILD CARDIOMEGALY WITH CEPHALIZATION OF THE PULMONARY VASCULATURE AND MILD AIRSPACE OPACITY COMPATIBLE WITH MILD EDEMA .
Impression and Plan
Impression
**AGE[in 70s] yo with recent subendocardial MI admitted to hospital for increased BP Plan
Cards .
HTN .
SBP this AM 190 .
Given hydralazine with good reponse .
Will increase lisinopril from 20 mg -- &gt ; 40 mg .
Will d/c current nitropaste .
If needed will consider adding clonidine to increase control .
For PRN control , continue with hydralazine .
Troponins negative .
Pulm .
Edema seen on CXR .
Given Lasix by ED .
Dialysis today should help .
Will recheck Xray in AM and follow clinically .
FEN .
Low K+ .
Will replete .
Renal .
ESRD .
Renal following .
Continue with dialysis .
On EPO for anemia .
Follow clinically .
Dispo .
Once BP better control , look to d/c back to home .
